Key Match Events: Malik Monk recorded 26 points, 12 assists, 4 steals, 3 rebounds, and 1 block
Domantas Sabonis had 22 points, 13 rebounds, and 7 assists
The Kings shot 44.2% from 3 while the Warriors shot 34.3%
Malik Monk tied his career high with 12 assists
Devin Carter finished with 13 points, 7 rebounds, 2 assists, and 1 steal
The Kings had 20-of-22 free throw conversions
The Warriors waved the white flag and cleared the bench at the start of the fourth quarter
Pre-Game Insights: De' Aaron Fox was absent from the game
Devin Carter played spirited defense and had 13 points, 7 rebounds, 2 assists, and 1 steal in his second NBA game
The Kings have won 4 straight games and are playing with a fire they did not have before
Doug Christie is reviving Sacramento's season and restoring hope that this season might not be over after all
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings dominated the Warriors and never took their foot off the gas
The Kings flipped the script and outshot the Warriors from 3-point range
Draymond Green set a screen on Keon Ellis and was ejected for a technical foul
Steve Kerr argued with the referees and received a technical foul
Doug Christie was on the floor and looked ready to fight Steve Kerr
Miscellaneous Highlights: DeMar DeRozan finished with a team-high 31 minutes
The Kings hosted the Miami Heat on Monday, January 6th at 7 PM PT
